metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5857 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - untriaged.
metadata.Description:
Inappropriate implementation in JavaScript in Google Chrome prior to 76.0.3809.87 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit object corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5857` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
